quotes.quote: If a person who indulges in gluttony is a glutton, and a person who commits a felony is a felon, then God is an iron.
Gluttony, do not eat thy neighbor's wife's popcorn.
Oh, pity the poor glutton whose troubles all begin in struggling on and on to turn what's out into what's in.
Gluttony and Lust are the only sins that abuse something that is essential to our survival.
A deadly sin that brings no evil material sequel to the satisfaction afforded by committing it is one thing. A deadly sin that gives you the stomach-ache is quite another.
Gluttons no longer gorge themselves; they are simply suffering from one of a variety of eating disorders.
Gluttony is mankind's exclusive prerogative.
Gluttony and vanity grow with age.
Gluttony is an emotional escape, a sign something is eating us.
The glutton is much more than an animal and much less than a man.
The most of what a glutton eats goes to create a desire for more.
There is no love sincerer than the love of food.
The flesh endures the storms of the present alone; the mind, those of the past and future as well as the present. Gluttony is a lust of the mind.
Gluttony and surfeiting are no proper occasions for thanksgiving.
In a way, gluttony is an athletic feat, a stretching exercise.
Gluttony and idleness are two of life's great joys, but they are not honourable.
Gluttony and drunkenness have two evils attendant on them; they make the carcass smart, as well as the pocket.
There is a difference between eating and drinking for strength and from mere gluttony.
Gluttony is not a secret vice.
Gluttony is the parent of disease.

Gluttony is the source of all our infirmities and the fountain of all our diseases. As a lamp is choked by a superabundance of oil, and a fire extinguished by excess of fuel, so is the natural health of the body destroyed by intempe diet.
Gluttony is the act of digging a grave with your own teeth.
It is the just doom of laziness and gluttony to be inactive without ease and drowsy without tranquility.
Only good poets cure us of an overindulgence in words. Only simple essential food cures us of gluttony

Gluttony might be innocuous were it not for the fact that gluttons tend to disregard whether their self-serving behaviors harm anyone else. We don't need to look far and wide to find examples of gluttonous behavior, as they are numerous throughout the history of capitalism.
Gluttony kills more than the sword.
